1.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

2.verse: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

3.verse: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.

4.verse: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

5.verse: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

6.verse: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

7.verse: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.

8.verse: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.

9.verse: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.

10.verse: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

11.verse: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

12.verse: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.

13.verse: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

14.verse: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
